lt.andrikonis.penkiolika

Class Penkiolika

  • java.lang.Object
    • lt.andrikonis.penkiolika.Penkiolika

  • public class Penkiolika
extends java.lang.Object
    The representation of Fifteen game (puzzle).

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffles the game board default number of times. For details see shuffle(int).

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(int times)
        Shuffles the game board. Moves the empty space specified number of times. It is guaranteed that the empty space will be moved exactly specified number of times. It is not guaranteed that the game state won't be repeated during the shuffle. Therefore if the argument is even there is a tiny possibility that the game state after the shuffle remains the same as before it.

        The shuffle is needed, because a randomly generated puzzle (game) might not be solvable. A puzzle created from a final state and shuffled is allways solvable (just as in the hardware version of the puzzle).

        Parameters:
        times - number of times to move the empty cell.

      • isFinal

        public boolean isFinal()
        Checks if the game is in the final state.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the game is in the final state.

      • moveTop

        public boolean moveTop()
        Moves the empty cell to the top, if it is a legal move. Does nothing otherwise.
        Returns:
        true, if the move was performed, false if it is not a legal move.

      • moveBottom

        public boolean moveBottom()
        Moves the empty cell to the bottom, if it is a legal move. Does nothing otherwise.
        Returns:
        true, if the move was performed, false if it is not a legal move.
